title: MS AccessDateAdd()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MS AccessDateAdd()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Add two years to a specified date:
SELECT DateAdd("yyyy", 2, #22/11/2017#);

Definition and Usage
The DateAdd() function adds a time/date interval to a date and then returns 
the date.
Syntax
DateAdd(
interval
,
number
,
date
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
interval
Required. The time/date interval to add. Can be one of the following values:
yyyy = Year
q = Quarter
m = month
y = Day of the year
d = Day
w = Weekday
ww = Week
h = hour
n = Minute
s = Second
number
Required. The number of
interval
to add to date. Can be 
    positive (to get dates in the future) or negative (to get dates in the past)
date
Required. The date to which the interval should be added
Technical Details
Works in:
From Access 2000
More Examples
Example
Add one year to the current system date:
SELECT DateAdd("yyyy", 1, Date());

Example
Add 6 months to the employees' birth date:
SELECT LastName, DateAdd("m", 6, BirthDate) FROM Employees;

❯
★
+1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code: SELECT LastName, DateAdd("m", 6, BirthDate) FROM Employees;

summary: This tutorial covers MS AccessDateAdd()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MS AccessDateAdd()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MS AccessDateAdd()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
